STYLE.NAME: Traditional Bock
STYLE.NOTES: High gravity lager from Einbeck, Germany. Smooth malty character with some chocolate or toasted edge. Under German law bocks must have a starting gravity of at least 16 plato (1.064)
STYLE.PROFILE: Medium to full body, malty flavor with some chocolate aroma. Little to no roast character. Low hop aroma and flavor to balance malt. Amber to brown color. Moderate carbonation.
STYLE.INGREDIENTS: Bulk of flavor and color is from dark Munich malt. Very small amounts of dark or chocolate malt. German hops for bittering only. German lager yeast. Moderate water hardness.
STYLE.EXAMPLES: Aass Bock, Einbecker Ur-bock, Great Lakes Rockefeller Bock
